document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of the Eriopisa group (Crustacea: Amphipoda: Eriopisidae) from Japan, with the description of a new genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of the Eriopisa group (Crustacea: Amphipoda: Eriopisidae) from Japan, with the description of a new genus

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Holotype : male (OMNH-Ar- 9721 ), 7.2 mm , mouth of Kamo River in Saijo City, Ehime Prefecture,
33 ° 55 ' 57 "N
,
133 °09'09"E
(
Fig. 1
A), sandy-muddy tidal flat, reverse surface of large stone (
Fig. 10
),
29 June 2014
, coll. T. Wada. Paratypes :
1 male
(OMNH-Ar- 9722 ), 7.6 mm , same data as holotype ; 1 ovigerous female (OMNH-Ar- 9723 ), 7.9 mm , same locality as holotype ,
27 June 2014
, coll. T. Wada;
1 female
(OMNH-Ar- 9724 ), 4.6 mm , and
3 juveniles
(OMNH-Ar- 9725–9727 ), 3.4 , 2.9 , 2.8 mm , mouth of Doki River in Marugame City, Kagawa Prefecture,
34 ° 18 ' 10 "N
,
133 ° 48 '07"E
(
Fig. 1
B), muddy tidal flat, reverse surface of large stone,
22 September 2014
, coll. T. Wada.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 10.
Victoriopisa wadai
sp. nov.
Holotype, male (OMNH-Ar-9721), 7.2 mm, and paratype, male (OMNH-Ar-9722), 7.6 mm. Photography by T. Wada.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Male [based on holotype , 7.2 mm (OMNH-Ar- 9721 ) and paratype , 7.6 mm (OMNH-Ar- 9722 ) for upper lip and lower lip]. Body (
Fig. 11
) slender, depressed laterally, smooth; urosomites free; pleonite 3 and urosomites
1 – 3
each with dorsal seta. Head longer than pereonite 1 , rostrum obsolescent, eyes absent; lateral cephalic lobe rounded, anteroventral sinus indistinct.

Antenna 1
(
Fig. 12
A, A 1 ) very long, with ratio of lengths of peduncular articles 1–3 1 : 0.9 : 0.3 , article 1 with 2 medial robust setae; accessory flagellum short, uniarticulated, with 5 setae distally; primary flagellum with 28 articles.
Antenna 2
(
Fig. 12
B, B
1 – 2
) short, with ratio of lengths of peduncular articles 3–5 1 : 1.8 :2.0; flagellum short, with 2 fused long articles and 3 short articles.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 11.
Victoriopisa wadai
sp. nov.
Holotype, male (OMNH-Ar-9721), 7.2 mm. Habitus, lateral view. Scale: 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Upper lip (
Fig. 12
C) entire, ventral margin setose. Mandible (
Fig. 12
D, D 1 , E, E 1 ), each incisor bearing 6 cusps, lacinia mobilis with 5 cusps in left, 3 cusps in right, accessory blades 4 (overlapped?) in left, 10 in right; molar strong; palp article length ratio 1 : 4.9 : 3.7 in left, 1 : 3.9 : 3.3 in right, article 2 with 3–4 setae ventrally, article 3 with 2 proximal and 9 distal setae. Lower lip (
Fig. 12
F) with small inner lobes bearing distal setae; medial margins of outer lobes setose, each with small projection.
Maxilla 1
(
Fig. 12
G, G 1 ), inner plate roundish, with several distal setae; outer plate with 9 robust setae apically; palp 2 -articulated, tip of article 2 projected, with 4 robust setae.
Maxilla 2
(
Fig. 12
H), inner plate as wide as outer, dorsal surface of inner plate with oblique row of setae, terminal ends of both plates setose. Maxilliped (
Fig.
12
I,
I
1 – 2
), inner plate truncate, distal end bearing 4 short robust setae; outer plate produced distomedially, without long robust setae; palp 4 -articulated, article 4 with short nail.

Gnathopod 1
(
Fig. 13
A, A 1 ) small, subchelate; coxa short, trapezoidal; basis widened in distal three fourths, posterior margin with 2 long setae, posterodistal corner setose; lateral and medial surfaces of merus covered with thin setae, distal margin with long setae; posterior margin of carpus heavily setose; propodus short, 65 % as long as carpus, widened distally, posterodistal corner with 5 medial robust setae, palm transverse; dactylus short, curved.
Gnathopod 2
(
Fig. 13
B, B 1 ) large, subchelate; coxa short, roundish rectangular, gill very large, curved posteriorly; basis widened in distal three fourths, posterior margin with 4 long setae, posterodistal corner setose; carpus lobed, posterior margin setose; propodus dilated, about 2.3 times as long as carpus, anterodistal corner setose, proximal part of posterior margin with 2 bundle of setae; palm oblique, composed of 3 lobes, 2 excavations and large robust seta, first lobe with 4 medial robust setae, second lobe with medial robust seta, third lobe without setae; dactylus stout, strongly curved.

Pereopods 3–4
(
Fig. 13
C – D) similar, slender; coxae short, rectangular, gills very large; bases linear, posterior margins with several long setae; meri slender, widened distally; dactyli narrow, slightly curved.
Pereopod 5
(
Fig. 13
E, E 1 ), posterior lobe of coxa a little shorter than anterior lobe, gill large, oval; basis longish oval, posterodistal corner rounded; merus slightly expanded; carpus with 2, 2 and 5 robust setae on anterior margin, anterodistal and posterodistal corners, respectively; dactylus short.
Pereopod 6
(
Fig. 13
F, F 1 ) about 1.3 times as long as pereopod 5 ; posterior lobe of coxa a little shorter than anterior lobe, gill small; basis longish oval, posterodistal corner rounded like pereopod 5 ; merus slightly expanded; anterior margin and anterodistal and posterodistal corners of carpus each with 4 robust setae; anterior margin and anterodistal corner of propodus each with 2 robust setae; dactylus narrow.
Pereopod 7
(
Fig. 13
G, G 1 ) about 1.2 times as long as pereopod 6 ; coxa short rectangular, not lobed; basis oval, posterodistal corner greatly swelled; merus moderately expanded, with 3 posterior robust setae; anterior margin and anterodistal and posterodistal corners of carpus with 4, 4 and 2 robust setae, respectively; anterior margin and anterodistal corner of propodus bearing 1 and 2 robust setae, respectively; dactylus narrow.

Pleonal epimera (
Fig. 14
A), posteroventral corner of epimeron 3 weakly projected; ventral margins of epimera
2 – 3
each with a few setae.
Pleopods 1–3
(
Fig. 14
B–D) long, similar in length; peduncles short, each with several anterior and lateral setae and 2 coupling hooks; inner rami subequal to outer, inner and outer rami with 15 and 20 articles in pleopod 1, 14 and 18 articles each in pleopod 2–3 , respectively.
Uropod 1
(
Fig. 14
E) biramous, long; peduncle bearing 2 ventrofacial and 5 dorsolateral robust setae, distomedial and distolateral corners with 1 and 3 robust setae, respectively; inner ramus 62 % length of peduncle, with 1 medial and 6 distal robust setae; outer ramus 57 % length of peduncle, with 2 medial, 1 lateral and 6 distal robust setae.
Uropod 2
(
Fig. 14
F) biramous, short, about half length of uropod 1 ; peduncle short, bearing 2 and 1 robust setae on dorsolateral margin and distolateral corner, respectively; inner ramus 93 % length of peduncle, with 1 medial and 5 distal robust setae; outer ramus 67 % length of peduncle, with 1 lateral and 5 distal robust setae.
Uropod 3
(
Fig. 14
G) extremely long, about 2.6 times as long as uropod 1 , biramous; peduncle short, with 1 and 2 robust setae on ventral surface and ventrodistal margin, respectively; inner ramus very short, scale-like, 29 % length of peduncle, with a few setae distally; outer ramus very long, about 3.4 times as long as peduncle; article 1 with several setae on medial margin and dorsal and ventral surfaces, distomedial corner with 2 robust setae, article 2 about 1.2 times as long as article 1 , medial margin with 6 robust setae, medial and dorsal surfaces bearing several setae, distal margin with many long setae. Telson (
Fig. 14
G, H) longer than broad, deeply incised; each lateral margin with 2 robust setae; each distal ends bearing robust seta, dorsal surface with pair of 1 and 2 plumose setae.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 12.
Victoriopisa wadai
sp. nov.
All except for B2, C and F, holotype, male (OMNH-Ar-9721), 7.2 mm; B2, C, F, paratype, male (OMNH-Ar-9722), 7.6 mm. A, right antenna 1, lateral view; A1, accessory flagellum of right antenna 1, lateral view; B, right antenna 2, lateral view; B1, flagellum of right antenna 2, lateral view, setae omitted; B2, flagellum of left antenna 2, lateral view, setae omitted; C, upper lip, anterior view; D, left mandible, medial view; D1, incisor, lacinia mobilis, accessory blades and molar of left mandible, medial view; E, right mandible, medial view; E1, incisor, lacinia mobilis, accessory blades and molar of right mandible, medial view; F, lower lip, ventral view; G, left maxilla 1, dorsal view; G1, distal part of left maxilla 1, dorsal view, normal setae omitted; H, left maxilla 2, ventral view; I, left maxilliped, ventral view; I1, distal part of inner plate of left maxilliped, ventral view, normal setae omitted; I2, distal part of outer plate of left maxilliped, ventral view, normal setae omitted. Scale: A, 2 mm; B, 1 mm; B1–2, C–I, 0.5 mm; A1, D1, E1, G1, I1–2, 0.25 mm.

FIGURE 13.
Victoriopisa wadai
sp. nov.
Holotype, male (OMNH-Ar-9721), 7.2 mm. A–B, left gnathopods 1–2, lateral views; A1, B1, palms of left gnathopods 1–2, lateral views, normal setae omitted; C–G, left pereopods 3–7, lateral views; E1, F1, G1, posterior parts of carpi of left pereopods 5–7, lateral views. Scales: A–G, 1 mm; B1, E1, F1, G1, 0.5 mm; A1, 0.25 mm.

FIGURE 14.
Victoriopisa wadai
sp. nov.
A–H, holotype, male (OMNH-Ar-9721), 7.2 mm; I–K, paratype, female (OMNH-Ar- 9723), 7.9 mm; L, paratype, juvenile (OMNH-Ar-9725), 3.4 mm. A, left pleonal epimera 1–3, lateral view; B, left pleopod 1, posterior view; C, left pleopod 2, anterior view; D, left pleopod 3, posterior view; E, left uropod 1, dorsolateral view; F, left uropod 2, dorsomedial view; G, left uropod 3 and telson, dorsal view; H, telson, dorsal view; I, accessory flagellum of right antenna 1, medial view; J–K, left gnathopods 1–2, lateral views; J1, K1, palms of left gnathopods 1–2, lateral views, normal setae omitted; L, propodus and dactylus of left gnathopod 2, lateral view, normal setae omitted. Scale: G, 1.33 mm; A–D, J–K, 1 mm; E–F, 0.67 mm; H, K1, L, 0.5 mm; I, J1, 0.25 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female [ paratype , 7.9 mm (OMNH-Ar- 9723 )]. Generally similar to male except for antenna 1 , gnathopods and oostegites.
Antenna 1
(
Fig.
14
I), accessory flagellum 2 -articulated.
Gnathopod 1
(
Fig. 14
J, J 1 ) almost similar to that of male, but carpus relatively longer, posterodistal corner with 7 medial robust setae.
Gnathopod 2
(
Fig. 14
K, K 1 ) almost similar to that of male, but coxa parallelogramatic, palm composed of 2 lobes, 1 excavation and large robust seta, first lobe with 6 medial robust setae, second lobe without setae. Oostegites present on coxae 2–5 .

Juvenile [ Paratype , 3.4 mm (OMNH-Ar- 9725 )].
Gnathopod 2
(
Fig. 14
L), palm smooth, with 3 small and 1 large medial robust setae.
Coloration in life. Whole body translucent white.
Etymology. Dedicated to Taichi Wada for donating many amphipod specimens collected from various tidal flats.

Remarks.
Lim et al . ( 2010 )
enumerated eight species in the genus
Victoriopisa
. But, in addition to those, two species and one subspecies were described:
V. chilkensis griffithsi
G.S. Karaman, 1984
;
V. guanarocana
Ortiz & Lalana, 1989
;
V. ovate (
Dang & Le, 2005
)
as
Eriopisa ovata
.
Victoriopisa wadai
sp. nov.
has the following characters: ( 1 ) eyes absent, ( 2 ) peduncle of antenna 1 not heavily setose, ( 3 ) accessory flagellum with 1–2 articles, ( 4 ) flagellum of antenna 2 composed of 2 long and 3 short articles, ( 5 ) gnathopod 2 in both sexes with excavated palm, ( 6 ) merus of pereopod 7 moderately expanded, and ( 7 ) ventral margin of pleonite 2 slightly setose. All species and subspecies of the genus do not have this combination of the characters [see
Lim et al . ( 2010 )
]. In particular, the gnathopod 2 with excavated palm is a unique character in the genus.
Victoriopisa ryukyuensis
from Japan differs from this new species in the presence of eyes, the heavily setose peduncle of antenna 1 , the greatly expanded merus of pereopod 7 , and the setose ventral margin of pleonite 2 .
